newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Two Venezuelan soldiers killed by Colombian rebels.
newsitem.headline: Two Venezuelan soldiers killed by Colombian rebels.

text.p: Two Venezuelan soldiers were killed on Tuesday by suspected Colombian guerrillas in the worst border incident in nearly a year, Defence Minister Pedro Nicolas Valencia said.

He told reporters the shooting occurred on Arauca River in Venezuela's western Apure state after leftist rebels opened fire on three army patrol boats. "The patrol was attacked along the international Arauca river from Arauqita on Colombian territory," Valencia said.

He said the "cowardly and treacherous" attack was probably carried out by rebels of the National Liberation Army (ELN), Colombia's second-largest guerrilla force, "because Araquita is in the hands of the ELN ... and guerrillas operate there freely."
Foreign Minister Miguel Burelli immediately asked Colombia to increase its military presence "in this part of Arauca where there is no control on the part of the Colombian state."

The attack was the latest in a spate of border incidents that have strained relations between the two countries. Venezuela and Colombia share a 1,400-mile (2,200-km) border, where kidnapping, drug trafficking and smuggling are common.
